attributes.action: Merge class 2 and and pcv licences into one
attributes.background:
Bus drivers carry the most precious cargo in the world, but cant drive a 32 tonne lorry full of groceries 
Give category D license holders their class 2 lgv license

attributes.action: Abolishment of the Scottish Parliament returning all powers to Westminster
attributes.background: It's time the Scottish Parliament was closed down and a referendum should be held to allow people of the United Kingdom to choose whether there tax payers money should continue to be wasted on having a Scottish Parliament

attributes.action: Mandatory health insurance for non UK citizens
attributes.background: Introduce health insurance for non UK citizens

attributes.action: Extend the 2 year old 15 hours childcare funding to deployed military's children
attributes.background: Often families are left struggling for support when servicemen and women are deployed for long periods of time, causing a disadvantage to their families, especially children below school age that do not have access to extra professional psychological support and the working parent left behind
attributes.additional_details: The extra money servicemen/women receive when deployed is spent on childcare if the other parent is working, or the other parent is forced to stop working, therefore taking away the incentive and consolation of being away from their families. The job requires short-notice deployments (often without a choice), meaning young children need professional emotional support and mothers struggle alone with children, often in towns faraway from the support of other family members and friends.

attributes.action: Stop the resident parent from dictating if the child should see the other parent
attributes.background: Resident parents of children get away far too much with using the child as a weapon and family law needs to be reformed to allow the non resident parent greater rights without going through the court system to see their children
attributes.additional_details: For example; the resident parent not answering phone calls/texts/emails from the non resident parent to make contact arrangements and not been at an arranged place so that contact can be made. Enforcement of court orders should be met with harsher punishments to the resident parent if the order is not kept to. Criminal law needs to be investigated further if allegations are made in family law situations to make it fair for non resident parents.

attributes.action: Increase award of Queens Silver Jubilee Medal.
attributes.background: The Queen Elizabeth II Silver Jubilee Medal  was created by a Royal Warrant but only 30,000 were distributed in Britain, resulting in only a small number being awarded to members of HM Armed Forces.  Subsequent Jubilee medals were awarded to all serving members of HM Armed Forces.
attributes.additional_details: In recognition of all those who served in HM Armed Forces at the time of Her Majesty's  Silver Jubilee, the existing monies in the Queens Silver Jubilee Trust should now be used to ensure an equitable distribution of the Silver Jubilee Medal.

attributes.action: Introduce 'Emily's Law' to ensure health and safety on privately-owned boats
attributes.background: 15 year old Emily Gardner from Gloucestershire died when her friend's boat capsized at sea. A catalogue of errors led to her death including the fact she was wearing a damaged and ill-fitting buoyancy aid. No laws currently exist to ensure that health and safety is observed on leisure craft.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/tearful-mum-watches-schoolgirls-lifeless-8088025

https://assets.digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk/media/5614f0fce5274a6251000003/MAIBInvReport21_2015.pdf

attributes.action: Freeze all disability benefits reviews for Scottish Residents till April 2017
attributes.background: It is only fair that sick or disabled citizens in Scotland should have a moratorium on benefit reviews until April 2017 when the Scottish government take over administration of these benefits.
attributes.additional_details: Scotland is getting control from April 2017 of certain parts of the benefit system including disability benefits.   Therefore, the UK government is wrong to assess people based on a system that will be changing in one year.  The system is not working due to the number of appeals being heard and won by the claimant meaning the administration and decision making is not fit for purpose.

attributes.action: Save Bolsover Community Hospital from closure
attributes.background: Bolsover community hospital is under threat from the public services cuts imposed by the current government. We need your help in saving our hospital which provides fantastic services and relieves the pressure on the larger hospitals which are already under strain.
attributes.additional_details: Bolsover community hospital is under threat of closure from the severe cuts facing all public services. The hospital offers physiotherapy treatment and advice, intermediate care services aiming to prevent people from being admitted to hospital which is essential for all major hospitals in the current financial climate and mental health services for the elderly which are essential in any community. Bolsover has lost a lot over the years, let's not add our hospital to the ever growing list.

attributes.action: Introduce an online voting option for elections
attributes.background: It's time for democracy in the UK to enter the 21st century and for online voting to be introduced.  Research has shown that over 95% of our 19,000+ elected politicians were voted in on turnouts of less than 50%, and many citizens with disabilities are currently locked out of the democratic process.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst the UK is a beacon of democracy around the world, it is severely lacking when it comes to voter participation.

The potential benefits of introducing an online voting method are many and include greater levels of participation; accessibility for those with vision impairments and other disabilities; long-term savings in the cost of elections; and accurate vote counts.

For information on the benefits of online voting and how it can be made secure visit webrootsdemocracy.org/reports.

attributes.action: Change legislation to enforce yellow box junctions around the Dartford Tunnel.
attributes.background: Changing current legislation would allow for the enforcement of yellow box junctions on the A206 approach to the Dartford Tunnels, J1A & 1B of the M25 via local authority powers. This will improve traffic flow in Dartford and surrounding areas when incidents and heavy congestion occur.
attributes.additional_details: Yellow box junctions are not currently enforceable outside of London.  Allowing Part 6 of the Traffic Management Act 2004 for England to be enabled around the Dartford Tunnel would allow for the civil enforcement (i.e. by local authorities) of moving traffic offences, such as yellow box junction enforcement. Enforcement of these offences in England outside London is currently the responsibility of police who do not have the resources to enforce this.

attributes.action: Only Residents and Domiciles should be allowed to own British media companies
attributes.background: In the USA there is a law that restricts the ownership of media to US citizens. Now the UK is leaving the EU we are free to do the same. Only people with a vested interest in this countries best interests should be allowed to control such powerful tools of public opinion.
attributes.additional_details: All the major owners of the pro Brexit press are either non residents in the UK or claim non domicile tax status in order to mitigate their fair share of tax. It is time to put a stop to this in the same way as the EU was trying. Let's finish the job they started.

attributes.action: Give legal protection to the professional title 'Sports Therapist'.
attributes.background: Currently the title 'sports therapist' is not protected in law, and anyone, even if they lack qualifications and training, can call themselves a sports therapist and undertake work on the public. We believe that this situation should be remedied by protecting the title 'sports therapist'.
attributes.additional_details: Currently the sports therapy profession has National Occupational Standards that all training providers should adhere to, there is also voluntary regulation in place, through the CNHC, which was established using government funding. The public are also further protected by an Accredited Register, however, as these are voluntary, it is still up to the individual to choose to be registered. We believe that by protecting the title, this will further protect the public from untrained individuals.

attributes.action: Stop vaccination with the Influenza Nasal Spray Vaccine in our schools.
attributes.background: There is parental concern about the use of the Influenza Nasal Spray Vaccine in schools.  There may be a risk of inhalation of the GM viral particles to those not consenting and evidence shows that recently vaccinated children may transmit the vaccine influenza strain to others in their community.
attributes.additional_details: If it is true that non consenting children are exposed to the GM viral particles or to the vaccine strains of influenza in school, the Nasal Spray Flu Vaccine Programme would appear to directly contradict the Secretary of State’s declaration in The Health Protection (Vaccination) Regulations 2009.  This states that 'there is no provision for imposing or enabling any restriction or requirement which has, or would have, a significant effect on a person’s rights'.

attributes.action: Add Makaton sign to the national primary school curriculum
attributes.background: Late talking and non-verbal children are often isolated and underestimated, even while surrounded by well intentioned teaching staff and classmates. Adding a simple sign system such as Makaton could bridge this gap, normalise difference and ultimately make for a more inclusive society.
attributes.additional_details: Neuro-typical Primary aged children brought up in multi-lingual environment can pick up multiple languages effortlessly. The young developing brain is a sponge for language. Teaching simple Makaton sign in schools would assist teachers and children to communicate with children who are late to develop and/or non/verbal. It would have the added benefit of providing a common back up for individuals who loose the power of speech in later life.

attributes.action: Declare all far right wing parties as terrorist organizations
attributes.background: Right wing parties and groups openly spread hate and cause bodily harm to innocent Muslims leading to psychological and physical trauma, disfigurement and even death.In a civilized society, such actions cannot be tolerated and hence Government needs to take strict actions to nip this evil in the bud
attributes.additional_details:
We demand Government to take following actions with immediate effect. 
1.All far right wing parties and groups to be declared terrorist organizations and should be dealt with under anti terrorism laws
2. Their crimes should be labeled as terrorism and their religious affiliation / beliefs should be made public
3. Their assets and bank accounts should be frozen
4. Non Muslims should be observed for islamophobic behavior in nurseries, schools, colleges, universities, places of work etc

attributes.action: To provide parents with information on dangers of cold sores for newborn babies
attributes.background: Before the age of 3 months a babies immune system cannot cope with the herpes simplex virus, if the baby contracts this it can lead to long term disabilities or could even be fatal. This is a very common virus that can be fatal for a baby, yet no information is provided by the NHS to pregnant women.
attributes.additional_details:
My daughter contracted this virus at 3 weeks old from being kissed by someone with a cold sore, she was in hospital for a week receiving treatment.  I shared this story on social media which went across the world. 
https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10207097809738910&set=a.1926244431082.109135.1091294407&type=3
 Since then many have people expressed their concern about not knowing that this could be dangerous for a baby, including the doctor we saw in accident and emergency.  Lots have people have sadly lost their babies because of this lack of knowledge.

attributes.action: Lower cervical smears age to 18 nationwide instead of 25
attributes.background: Cervical smears used to provided to women at the age of 20 in wales, then the age was upped to 25 due to the fact that cervical cancer is very rare in unders 25's, yet more and more women are having abnormal smears and younger women are being diagnosed with cervical cancer more frequently.
attributes.additional_details: If abnormal cells are detected earlier then the risk of cervical cancer will be lowered OR the severity of treatment will be lowered. Some servere treatment can include things that will lower your chances of being able to conceive naturally or even conceive at all. Extreme treatment can mean having a hysterectomy. Anyone who is sexually active can contract hpv virus which in some circumstances can lead to abnormal cells which in turn can lead to cervical cancer

attributes.action: PIP should have life-time awards for life-long and/or progressive conditions.
attributes.background: There should be a category of life-time award for PIP (as with DLA) so that disabled individuals with life-long and/or progressive conditions, which by there very nature will not improve do not have to undergo needless and repeated assessments which may cause unnecessary stress to those individuals.

attributes.action: Call a snap general election now that the UK have voted to leave the EU
attributes.background: Call a snap general election now that the UK have voted to leave the EU, so that political parties can tender their manifestos so they can lay out to us the electorate their plans for a UK outside the European Union.

attributes.action: Publicly own all NHS land and assets, and directly employ all NHS staff.
attributes.background: The NHS is being systematically destroyed by fragmentation, cuts, closures, under-funding, under-staffing, privatisation, PFI debts and state asset stripping.
attributes.additional_details: A US Commonwealth Fund report showed the NHS is the best and most cost-effective health service in the developed world, and that the US system is among the worst and most costly. UK governments over decades have been working to replace our NHS with a US style system. That costs twice as much per capita as the NHS, and ~30% of costs go on admin. Pre-marketisation NHS admin cost ~5%. The market has increased it to ~15% (£10 bn pa wasted and rising). 1 in 5 US citizens cannot afford any healthcare.

attributes.action: The Hillsborough stadium disaster should be included in the National curriculum.
attributes.background: In 1989, 96 Liverpool fans were unlawfully killed at Hillsborough during the FA Cup Semi Final. There are 1000s of school children today that have little knowledge about the disaster. I propose that it should be included in the National Curriculum at key stages 3 and 4.
attributes.additional_details: I am head of Geography and Citizenship at South Wirral High School and for the past 4 years we have held a "Hillsborough day" for year 10. The day includes 4 key lessons: the truth, the fight for justice, the role of the media and the legacy on football. The day has been so well received by year 10. I want every child in the country to learn the truth about the events that day so that no child grows up with misconceptions about Hillsborough. Importantly, I want the legacy of the 96 to live on.

attributes.action: Bring back compulsory tick treatment for dogs entering the UK
attributes.background: In 2012 the requirement for dogs entering the UK was dropped. Dogs encountering ticks abroad may be exposed to pathogens not present in the UK with the risk of tick-borne disease being brought back to the UK. This puts not only dogs, but humans at risk.

attributes.action: Require government bodies to allow use of gender-neutral honorifics e.g. "Mx"
attributes.background: When interacting with the government you often have to provide a title from a preset list of options. Many people prefer to use no title, or a gender-neutral title: government bodies should offer gender-neutral options e.g. "Mx", as well as the option to use no title at all.
attributes.additional_details: Preset lists of titles often include very rare titles (not many people are professors or Wing Commanders!) but offer no gender-neutral option for people who aren't doctors, don't have doctorates, or aren't a member of the clergy or military. Many organisations now offer the gender-neutral title "Mx" as one of their pre-set options, including e.g. the NHS and the Co-Op. All government bodies should offer the gender-neutral non-specialist titles (e.g. Mx) or no title as a matter of policy.

attributes.action: Prevent the new HS2 proposed line passing through Bramley, Rotherham
attributes.background: HS2 are proposing a new route for the line to pass through the village of Bramley. This means it will be dangerously close to local housing and other ameneties which raises a number of concerns including:- safety of local children, noise polution, negative impact on house prices, to name (but) a few

attributes.action: Abolish VED (generally known as Road Tax) on all Powered 2 Wheelers
attributes.background:
Motorcycles/scooters reduce congestion, use less parking land space, cause less wear & tear to the roads than other forms of sustainable modes of transport. 
Abolishing VED can encourage more to use P2Ws, even a car with a VED yearly price of £30 doesn't reduce congestion or parking land space!
attributes.additional_details:
Quote...This is the first time that the European Parliament recognizes the importance of motorcycles for transport. We have been saying for a long time, that motorcycles are part of the solution for urban congestion, environment and parking problems... 
http://www.fema-online.eu/website/index.php/2015/09/09/aggwdfwertwd/

attributes.action: Increase the funding for settings for free childcare/education for 2-4 year olds
attributes.background: All 3 to 4-year-olds (and some 2 years olds) in England can get 570 hours of free early education or childcare per year. However, the amount the government pays early years settings is well below what it costs in real terms, meaning settings are under threat of closing or raising fees sky high.
attributes.additional_details:
We welcome the new 30 hour free childcare proposals, but the amount funded to settings needs to be significantly increased. The additional hours, as well as the rise in the national living wage puts more stress on already stretched settings. Small settings and childminders in rural, poorly funded areas are most at risk. Please support us!
https://www.gov.uk/help-with-childcare-costs/free-childcare-and-education-for-2-to-4-year-olds
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-32928117

attributes.action: Change NHS sight tests to meet the needs of people with learning disabilities
attributes.background: There are huge levels of sight problems amongst people with learning disabilities but they suffer unequal access to eye care. This is leaving many people with poor vision or even tragically losing their sight.
attributes.additional_details: The charity SeeAbility is calling for national pathways of eye care for people with learning disabilities, including for children in special schools, and for all working age adults with learning disabilities to be eligible for NHS funded sight tests. People are likely to need additional time or appointments to complete a sight test. This requires the Department of Health and NHS England to change the statutory and funding framework for NHS sight tests, to deliver an equal right to sight.

attributes.action: Stop HS2 running through the Dearne Valley and destroying our community
attributes.background: On 7th July 2016 HS2 announced their intention to run the line through the Dearne Valley, destroying the new Shimmer estate and blighting hundreds of other homes in the area. In addition, this will involve the destruction of local wildlife habitats and a huge viaduct blighting open countryside.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/hs2-plan-and-profile-maps-conisbrough-to-ryhill

attributes.action: Allow only pre-stunned slaughter.
attributes.background: We call for an end to slaughter without pre-stunning for all animals. EU and UK law requires all animals to be pre-stunned before slaughter to render them insensible to pain until death supervenes.
attributes.additional_details: The practice of slaughter without pre-stunning is already banned in Denmark, Sweden, Poland, Switzerland and Norway.

attributes.action: Amend Forestry Byelaws to aid the rescue of injured animals to prevent suffering
attributes.background:
Amend Statutory instrument 1982 no 648 the forestry commission byelaw xviii to allow exceptions for animal rescues to assist injured animals. 
FC staff only work M-F 9-3, no ranger service outside these hours. In addition not every animal that is injured needs to be shot and deserve to be helped.
attributes.additional_details:
The Animal Welfare Act 2006 (c.45 Prevention of harm, Unnecessary Suffering) contradicts this byelaw and makes it clear that a person commits an offence if we do not act immediately; 
•	an act of his, or a failure of his to act, causes an animal to suffer, (b) he knew, or ought reasonably to have known, that the act, or failure to act, would have that effect or be likely to do so, (c ) the animal is a protected animal, and (d) the suffering is unnecessary.

attributes.action: Penalise any MP who jeers or shouts during a speech by any other MP.
attributes.background:
During any debate in the House of Commons we feel that there should be no shouting or jeering by anyone whilst an MP is speaking. We feel that this is unsatisfactory behaviour by our elected MPs and unbecoming of a member of parliament.
We demand that there be a penalty imposed by way of expulsion.
attributes.additional_details:
Upon witnessing many debates in the House of Commons it is very off putting when members of the house shout and jeer over the top of someone attempting to speak and put their point forward.
I do not want my elected MP, or any other MP, who represents the residents of this country to act in this juvenile and unprofessional way.
Everyone from every political party should have the chance to speak without interruption.
Any person found to be doing this should be ejected from the house immediately.

attributes.action: Make Kratom exempt from the UK Psychoactive Substances Act
attributes.background: Kratom should be included in the exemptions list, so that the Government can at least make an educated decision on this special herb that has benefited so many peoples lives for the better. We believe  Kratom should be reviewed by the government using real case studies and peoples testimonies.
attributes.additional_details: Kratom has helped millions of people worldwide who have found prescription medication ineffective. It has given hope back to people who have relied on opiate based medicines for chronic pain. Kratom has also helped people who have suffered from anxiety and depression and numerous other ailments for years, allowing them to finally get there life back. To make Kratom illegal would have a devastating effect on so many people that rely on this herb and we ask you to reconsider on this matter.

attributes.action: Make sure that all councils give every British homeless person a home
attributes.background:
In this country right now, there are too many British people who are homeless either through no fault of their own or by not paying extortionate amounts of rent money.

This country must get its priorities right by housing our own people instead of making homelessness look like a crime.

attributes.action: Keep the Free Movement of People Between the UK and the EU
attributes.background: Britain has voted to leave the EU. Negotiations will soon begin to decide how Britain and the EU go forward over the next few years. We ask that as part of that negotiation, any Prime Minister will ensure that the free movement of people between the UK and the EU will be retained.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of the symptoms of Type 1 diabetes in the UK
attributes.background: The number of children being diagnosed with Type 1 diabetes is rising at an alarming rate, especially in the under 5s. Unfortunately many people are unaware of the symptoms. This needs to change, children are dying due to mis-diagnoses. We, as a family were lucky with our son, we knew the signs.
attributes.additional_details:
What is needed is an awareness campaign like in 2000 when there was a country wide campaign to highlight the symptoms of meningitis. 
Type 1 diabetes can kill equally as quickly as meningitis.
Education is needed for parents, carers, and even those in the medical profession.

attributes.action: Make sex education compulsory, with lessons on consent and sexual orientations
attributes.background: In February, Nicky Morgan said that sex education would no longer be compulsory. Yet it is vital that young people are informed about practicing safe sex, what consent is and its importance and sexual orientations in order to prevent unwanted pregnancies, STDs, rape & confusion about sexual identity
attributes.additional_details: According to the Office for National Statistics, "Nearly three-quarters (73%) of female victims of rape offences and over three-quarters (78%) of female victims of other sexual offences recorded by the police were aged under 30. Male victims of rape and other sexual offences were even more likely to be aged under 30 (88% and 84% respectively)," in the year ending March 2015. It is crucial that young people know what consent is, how to give/receive consent and tear sex without consent is rape

attributes.action: Bring Animal Welfare into the School Curriculum
attributes.background: It is becoming all to common now to see on social media sights people filming children hitting, pulling and pushing animals around. Not only do more people need educated on how to cope with animals and young children in the family home, but the children need to learn how to act appropriately.

attributes.action: Simplify the process of getting British citizenship for resident EU citizens
attributes.background:
EU citizens resident in the UK for at least 5 years have to be offered a simple process to gain British citizenship to ensure they have the right to remain, live and work in the UK indefinitely and irretrievably.
The current process is complicated and many families can not afford it.
attributes.additional_details:
EU citizens have built carriers, started businesses, payed taxes, contributed to the community and most importantly the UK had become their home.
The UK leaving the EU makes these EU citizens feel second class citizens in their home. They feel unwanted, discriminated and they are left in uncertainty. 
The current process for them to become British citizens is complicated and expensive. UK Government must protect the rights of these EU citizens and simplify the process of their naturalisation.

attributes.action: STOP all SATs testing in KS1+2 AND Help TEACHERS make decisions about EDUCATION
attributes.background:
SATs do not improve pupils’ learning.
There is no evidence that end of Key Stage tests have led to individual pupils reaching higher levels of attainment than they would have done if the tests had not been introduced (CambridgeReview).
SATs reduce pupil’s access to a broad and balanced curriculum.
attributes.additional_details:
Repeated testing and preparation for the tests de-motivates children and reduces their learning potential, as it encourages them to use strategies designed to gain marks in the tests, rather than increase their understanding.
 SATs have a negative impact on children’s well-being. Pupils, particularly those who are less able, have a more negative attitude to school and to their own ability to learn, due to the pressure and stress of testing (Evidence for Policy and Practice Information Centre).

attributes.action: Dedicate more funding and resources to support male victims of domestic abuse.
attributes.background: In the UK men are estimated to make up between 1/3 and 1/2 of domestic abuse victims yet despite this there is little to no funding or support for them in the UK. Local authorities receive no money to help them and there are no publicly funded shelters specifically for men and their children.
attributes.additional_details:
This lack of support is harming male victims of domestic abuse everyday and something needs to be done about it. 
Source:
http://www.parity-uk.org/male_dom_abuse2.php

attributes.action: Create a fund to help sustain the official voluntary UK Search & Rescue teams
attributes.background: The UK's official Mountain and Lowland Rescue teams offer vital professional assistance to the Emergency Services in times of personal, local or national crisis.  They are the unseen, unsung local heroes behind many headlines, but they receive no funding and several are struggling to exist.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition asks the government to consider supporting the official UKSAR* volunteer-manned rescue teams with funds to cover their insurance, rent of premises, fuel or maintenance, which is the financial burden that teams find hardest to bear. 

*UKSAR is an official group reporting to the government and in this case refers to member teams of the Association of Lowland Search & Rescue, and Mountain Rescue England and Wales, who work with the emergency services on a non-paid, non-funded basis.

attributes.action: Call a general election if the UK votes to leave the EU.
attributes.background:
If the UK electorate vote to leave the EU a general election should be called to ensure a new mandate to govern is obtained. 

The current government will have no real, legitimate mandate to govern if the the UK leaves the current system. Especially as the leader is campaigning to stay in.

attributes.action: Hold a vote of no confidence in Her Majesty's Government
attributes.background: We the undersigned call for a vote of no confidence in Her Majesty's Government, given the divisiveness of the EU referendum, the shockingly poor leadership shown by the current government, and the fact that David Cameron's replacement will not have the mandate of the people.

attributes.action: Military personnel serving or veteran should be exempt VAT on all products.
attributes.background: Having been in the military for 24+ years recently there has been a surge in people giving certain discounts to the military. Whilst helpful it is different in every store and vary from 1-20%. If this was available no company would lose out, the service person would also know where they stand.
attributes.additional_details:
I have asked for military discount in various stores and been embarrassed when told they dont offer the discount. I never argued and just paid the full amount, checked again when I got home only to find their company do offer the discount.

If the VAT were scrapped this would allow all serving personnel past & present to know their country appreciates their service by giving a little back. A veteran ID card would have to be issued upon their leaving the military.

attributes.action: No 2 year EU "Article 50" procedure to delay leaving the EU for 2 years.
attributes.background: David Cameron would invoke article 50 as the route out of the EU in the vent of a "leave" vote. This "negotiation" lasting for 2 years and longer if EU ministers decide upon it. The UK government is within it's right to simply walk away immediately.There should be no backtracking . OUT is OUT

attributes.action: Stop Foreign Aid and divert the money to the NHS.
attributes.background: British people pay their taxes towards the NHS. They are having to wait longer and longer on waiting lists due to the service being used by non tax payers who have no right to free treatment. Foreign aid comes out of our taxes so it should be stopped and used for British tax payers.

attributes.action: Increase the maximum sentence for animal cruelty charges
attributes.background: The law is failing to adequately protect animals and ensure that punishment administered to those responsible for acts of cruelty fits the crime.
attributes.additional_details:
Under the Animal Welfare Act, the term of imprisonment for even the most heinous of crimes does not exceed 51 weeks. All too often abusers are “getting away with murder". A lifetime ban and/or fine is insufficient. 

We demand review of the Animal Welfare Act, increasing the powers of local authorities to protect animals and to increase the maximum sentence these crimes hold. At a minimum, animal cruelty should hold punishment similar to Actual Bodily Harm (ABH) & Grievous Bodily Harm (GBH).

attributes.action: Allow serving members in armed forces & veterans free travel on public transport
attributes.background: in the uk disabled people unemployed and the old can jump on buses for free and in some areas can use rail networks on a discount, at current the armed forces have to pay for a rail card, yet inthe US , canada and some parts of the EU there veterans and serving soldiers can travel for free.
attributes.additional_details:
the UK has loads of veterans aged 22- 75 with the most being in the    22 - 30  aged group for the first time since WW2 due to commitments in afghan and iraq in the last decade,
TFL has awarded a 3 year Oyster card for veterans who have been injured in service, this should not be a perk but a recconition to the service given and extended to all train and bus companies in the UK
 at any time with either there military id or veterans badge.
